sentence.Network_en: His irreverence for authority marks him out as a troublemaker.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对权威的不敬使他成了一个惹是生非的刺儿头。

sentence.Network_en: I would hate you to think me a troublemaker.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不愿你认为我是个搬弄是非的人.

sentence.Network_en: I put the boy down as a troublemaker as soon as I saw him.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一看见这孩子就以为他很调皮.

so if you get into trouble , that doesn't mean you're a troublemaker , it means you need to try harder to act right .因此，如果你遇到麻烦，那并不表示你是麻烦的制造者，而意味着你需要更加努力去把它做对。

entry.tran: 闹事者;捣乱分子;(尤指）煽动作乱者
entry.def: If you refer to someone as a troublemaker, you mean that they cause unpleasantness, quarrels, or fights, especially by encouraging people to oppose authority.

example.ex: The regional governor has been given powers to outlaw strikes and expel suspected troublemakers.
example.tran: 地方长官被赋予禁止罢工、驱逐嫌疑闹事者的权力。

means.word_mean: 1. someone who deliberately stirs up trouble

auth_sentence.content: This man was not, by nature, a troublemaker.

sentences.en: He was employed to chuck out any troublemakers.
I put the boy down as a troublemaker as soon as I saw him.
sentences.cn: 我一看见这孩子就以为他很调皮。

sentences.en: I would hate you to think me a troublemaker.
sentences.cn: 我不愿你认为我是个搬弄是非的人。

sentences.en: She had automatically labelled the boys as troublemakers.
sentences.cn: 她不假思索地认定这些男孩子是捣蛋鬼。
